intro: Ptisana boivinii, commonly known as the Boivin's ptisana, is a species of flowering plant in the family Asteraceae. It is native to Madagascar and is characterized by its distinctive yellow flowers and narrow, grass-like leaves. The plant typically grows in open, sunny habitats such as grasslands and rocky outcrops. Ptisana boivinii is a perennial herb that produces small, daisy-like inflorescences. Due to its limited distribution and habitat specificity, it is considered a rare and endangered species.
